subject: Design
title: The Safety Pin: Genius in Simplicity
description: One-minute skill: The Safety Pin: Genius in Simplicity.

hook.text: In 1849, Walter Hunt owed someone $15. He bent a wire for three hours and changed the world.

buildup.text: Hunt twisted a single piece of wire into a clasp with a spring and a shielded point.

discovery.text: The safety pin solved a problem humans had for millennia: fastening fabric without stabbing yourself.

twist.text: Hunt sold the patent for $400 to pay his debt. It went on to generate millions.

climax.text: 175 years later, the safety pin's design is unchanged â€” because it was perfect from day one.

punchline.text: Perfect design doesn't need a second version.

quiz.question: Why has the safety pin's design remained unchanged?
options: No one tried to improve it
